definition: to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: The declining family circumstances of the Compsons is the symbol of the dying away of the old South tradition.
sentences.chinese: 康普生的家境衰败就是蓄奴制旧南方衰亡的缩影。

sentences.english: After Ban Gu, Great Han Ode began to decline.
sentences.chinese: 汉大赋的兴盛局面难以为继，开始走向衰败。

sentences.english: The leaves of infected plants weaken and become yellow. They also leak a yellow liquid.
sentences.chinese: 受感染的植株叶子会衰败，变黄，并流出黄色液体。

sentences.english: Manufacturing, once America’s greatest strength, seemed to be in terminal decline.
sentences.chinese: 曾经是美国最为强实力的制造业到了走到末路的衰败。

sentences.english: There is no sweeter sound than the crumbling of one's fellow man.
sentences.chinese: 再也没有比听到同胞衰败崩溃的声音更令人高兴的了。

sentences.english: During his life time the Tang Dynasty was in decay .
sentences.chinese: 杜甫生活得年代，唐朝已经由兴盛走向衰败。

sentences.english: Thinking of his declining family, he heaves a deep sigh over the fleetness of fate.
sentences.chinese: 看到他们家衰败的样子，他不禁喟然长叹命运的无常。

sentences.english: They're only in the process of falling.
sentences.chinese: 他们只是处在不断衰败的过程中。

sentences.english: During the middle ages, Greek civilization declined and became effete .
sentences.chinese: 在中世纪期间，希腊文明开始衰落直至衰败。

sentences.english: There were also various so-called rotten or pocket boroughs.
sentences.chinese: 还有各种称之为衰败或口袋选区的选区。

sentences.english: It was a very gradual and elegant decline of the British Royal Navy.
sentences.chinese: 英国皇家海军的衰败是非常平缓和优雅的。

sentences.english: Tones, and dark carpets fluff decline in not-so-obvious.
sentences.chinese: 中色调和深色调地毯绒毛衰败不太明显。

sentences.english: It was a narrative of victimhood and decline that I’d often heard in China.
sentences.chinese: 我在中国常常听到这种因为侵略导致衰败的说法。

sentences.english: WebUrbanist: Why do you feel it is important to share images decaying America?
sentences.chinese: 您为什么会认为分享这些衰败的美国影像很重要？

definition: to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
(of status or wealth) to decline/(of buildings etc) to become dilapidated/run-down/(of plants) to wilt
to decline/to die out/decline and fall
to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate
to decline/to fall/to drop/to falter/a decline/recession (in economics)
